owlSpeak.engine

Class OwlScript

  • java.lang.Object
    • owlSpeak.engine.OwlScript

  • public class OwlScript
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that is used for evaluating the OwlScript expressions
    Author:
    Dan Denich

      this function is used to check if the string can be interpreted directly or if it is more complex and needs recursive calls

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        the main method is only used for testing the functions
        Parameters:
        args -

      • evaluateString

        public static java.lang.String[] evaluateString(java.lang.String input)
        this function parses the input. it takes the string from the beginning to the first bracket as a command. it then calls the corresponding functions. returned string might contain parentheses and semi-colons
        Parameters:
        input - the input string
        Returns:
        a string vector containing the command in field [0], the string in [1] (and optional [2] if the command is "IF")

      • parse

        public static java.lang.String parse(java.lang.String input)
        this function is used to check if the string can be interpreted directly or if it is more complex and needs recursive calls
        Parameters:
        input - the input string
        Returns:
        returns the result of the interpreted string, usually 0 or 1

      • Vect2Str

        public static java.lang.String Vect2Str(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> input)
        this function transforms a vector to a string by calling toString and removing spaces and commata
        Parameters:
        input - the input String vector
        Returns:
        the concated string

      • parseBrackets

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> parseBrackets(java.lang.String input)
        this function is used for analyzing the string and the given brackets. it returns a vector of string that can be interpreted or recombined.
        Parameters:
        input - the input String
        Returns:
        a vector that contains split-parts of the inputstring

      • validate

        public static int validate(java.lang.String input)
        this function is used for the logic parsing. it checks for expressions like (a++b) and returns a+b
        Parameters:
        input - the input String
        Returns:
        an integer that is either 0 or 1

      • getSets

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getSets(java.lang.String input)
        this function transforms an input string to a vector, taking ";" as separation character
        Parameters:
        input - the input String
        Returns:
        a vector containing the parts of the String (each string with a leading opening and a trailing closing bracket)

      • parseSet

        public static java.lang.String[] parseSet(java.lang.String input)
        this function splits the input string into an array with two elements, taking "=" as the removed separation character
        Parameters:
        input - the input String, may have opening and closing parentheses
        Returns:
        a String array with two fields, opening and closing parentheses are discarded

      • parseOperatorSequence

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> parseOperatorSequence(java.lang.String sequence)
        Splits a variable operator sequence at the ";" sign. Assumes that the variable operator is syntactically correct.
        Parameters:
        sequence -
        Returns:
